result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Jesus Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling
Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Jesus Gonzalez

records.addlTxt: Defense requesting a new hearing date. Parties notified via zoom of hearing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of 1 YEAR in the House of Corrections, CONCURRENT WITH any other sentence; with credit for 9 DAYS. REMAND. 

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/ extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 3: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, CONCURRENT WITH COUNT 2.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS.  

The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

The Court STAYED the sentences in COUNTS 2 AND 3 and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 5 YEARS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/ extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
AODA Assessment and other counseling needs to be determined.
Mental Health Assessment and comply with treatment.
No contact with Oak Barrell 1033 N. Old World Third Street, Buck Bradleys 1019 Old World Third Street or Avenue MKE 275 W. Wisconsin Avenue.

The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

Defendant Antonio Jesus Gonzalez in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Antonio Jesus Gonzalez in custody.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 AND 3 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Case proceeded to sentencing. 

e-FILED: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions  Restitution hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Jury Instruction - filed with plea questionnaire
Jury Instructions - filed with plea questionnaire
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Antonio Jesus Gonzalez not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy, appearing for Kelly Hedge, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel advises Court that defendant has a pending case in Branch 38 and is requesting this case be transferred to Branch 38 for global resolution.

Court is willing to transfer this case to Branch 38 for global resolution and is willing to accept the Branch 38 case providing they are willing to transfer it.
Case is adjourned to Branch 38 for plea and sentencing.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Antonio Jesus Gonzalez in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Antonio Jesus Gonzalez in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Ertl. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Antonio Jesus Gonzalez in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Antonio Jesus Gonzalez in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Antonio Jesus Gonzalez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
